titleInfo.title: Was brought to the First District Police Prison.

mods.abstract: WAS Brought to the First District Police Prison -- ISAM, a light griffe, about 53 years old, 5 feet 9 inches high, says he belongs to Mr. John Bundy, at Baton Rouge. CAROLINE, a mulattress, about 11 years old, 4 feet 3 1/2 inches high, toes off the feet, says he belongs to Mr. G. R. Beard. VICTOR, a black, about 15 years old, 5 feet 5 inches high, says he belongs to Mr. Davis. The owners will please comply with the law respecting them. J. WORRALL, Warden. NewOrleans, April 11, 1852. ap12 1aw3w
mods.note: Mr. John Bundy; Mr. G.R. Beard; Mr. Davis

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
